content.question: ​For a polynomial function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math>, <math alttext="limit as x rightwards arrow negative infinity of f open parentheses x close parentheses equals infinity"><munder><mi>lim</mi><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mo>-</mo><mo>∞</mo></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mo>∞</mo></math> and <math alttext="limit as x rightwards arrow infinity of f open parentheses x close parentheses equals negative infinity"><munder><mi>lim</mi><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mo>∞</mo></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mo>∞</mo></math>. Which of the following must be true about <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> ?

choices.label: ​The degree of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is even, and the leading coefficient is negative.
​The degree of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is even, and the leading coefficient is positive.
​The degree of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is odd, and the leading coefficient is negative.
​The degree of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is odd, and the leading coefficient is positive.

content.answer: ​The degree of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is odd, and the leading coefficient is negative.

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Describe the characteristics of a function with varying levels of precision, depending on the function representation and available mathematical tools.
